alert.note: Alert for Shasta Lake Area, Northern Shasta County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 5:11PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Shasta County through 600 PM PDT... At 511 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Vollmers, or 15 miles north of Shasta Dam, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lakehead-Lakeshore, Lakehead, Vollmers, Pollard Flat and Sugarloaf. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
